review_title: Victure 1080P Captures Rogue BEAR Images and Video with Stunning Clarity!
review_body: OK I have to admit that my title was meant to catch your attention.  I have a wonderful 4 year old MaltiPoo named BEAR. My wife and son have spent the summer with family in Lake Tahoe so it has just been my dog and me roughing it at home. I bought the Victure 1080P on Amazon Prime day because it was a great deal and I wanted to be able to see what Bear did all day by himself while I am at work.  During the school year my wife is at home with him every day so he is never alone.Since Bear is pretty much everyone's favorite "family member" I also wanted my wife and son to be able to check in on him from their phones too.I've worked with many security cameras over the years and my hobby since I was a teen has been video and video editing, so believe me when I tell you that this Pan & Tilt Wireless Security Camera records the best images and video I have seen for this class of camera.  The images are sharp, bright and colorful!The  Pan and Tilt mechanics are nothing short of amazing.  The camera responds extremely fast moving from one set angle to the next.  It really is impressive how quickly it pans/tilts.I really liked the fact that it automaps a 360 degree panoramic photo so you can quickly move the camera to record an exact scene.One day I wanted to be alerted when a package came so I put it on the kitchen window sill and had it record the entrance area through the window.  The image was crystal clear and I was alerted the moment the delivery person opened our gate.On the one hand both my wife and son were able to connect to the camera with very little help from me since they are 500 miles away relaxing on the beach while I toil in the salt mines (I'm not bitter that they're enjoying a 6 week vacation..not a bit)  but on the other hand my wife says she can't bear to watch our Bear because it makes her sad that all he does is wait by the door for me someone to come home.So now as a result of getting this truly amazing camera at a great deal  I now have to pay someone to go by my house twice a day to play with Bear until my family comes home from their extended vacation.You can't go wrong if you purchase the Victure 1080P FHD WiFi IP Camera, you will be amazed at the build quality, features and recorded images and video quality that it produces.I almost forgot to mention the customer service is outstanding!  I could not have been more impressed with my interactions with Rebecca.

review_body: Overall I like the easy of use this camera offers. It is not difficult to setup and is quite easily controlled through your phone. The picture quality is pretty decent--though I wish the camera had wider angles on both axis. I also love the ability to talk to the camera side of things through my phone. For the price of this camera, it's a good buy with only one real negative that ALMOST renders this camera useless in some situations, and definitely limits your options for placement--the wireless connection and the ability to watch the stream in real time. It is absolutely garbage. If the camera is within the line of sight of your router, it's a decent connection with near real-time, uninterrupted video. Put a single wall or the floor between the camera and router... forget about using the wireless connection. The signal strength emitted by the camera is downright disappointing. I know it's the camera's antenna because I have upgraded antenna's on my router. Without hardwiring the camera or placing it in the same room as your router, the ability to remote into the camera to view live feed is nearly nonexistent. When a connection is actually established through the app, the bitrate is so slow that it takes tens of seconds to send or receive commands (Camera movement), and the video is delayed, intermittent, and cuts out constantly. For the price, a good camera. I would hardly classify it as a wireless though.UPDATE 11/5/18: Downgraded from a generous 4 stars (rounded up from 3.5) to a 1 star. Like I mentioned in my earlier review, this camera had absolutely terrible wireless reception. I have a reputable, nice router with upgraded antennas and the wireless just connected at best. Fast forward to today, the camera won't connect wirelessly at all anymore. I tried to reset and reprogram the camera via the APP and it  does nothing.Also, I emailed the company about the PC software they offered in response to another customer's question, and I never got a response. Very disappointed in this camera. I bought it for it's wireless function and instead it's now an ugly paperweight. It may have some use in the future if I hardwire it though.

review_title: Can be hacked and controlled by someone else, DO NOT BUY!
review_body: 1st IPC360 camera:The original purchase would not connect through WiFi and would only connect using an ethernet cable and Amazon replaced it with the second.2nd IPC camera:The replacement connected through WiFi without any issues and worked as it stated in the description of the listing.After a couple days of owning the replacement the camera started to operate and move on its own at night, leading me to believe that some how it was being controlled by someone other than myself. The only person that had granted access to the camera was on my phone. This camera was set up in my bedroom and only paired to my own personal cellphone.  Before I go to bed I set the camera to view the wall so that it isn't in view of the room. At night I could hear the camera moving and adjusting so that it could get a view of where it was. The camera did not do one full rotation as if it were reseting itself, it rotated to one side then attempted to rotate some more to look around. Luckily for me I placed tape over the infrared lights the day I purchased it so that I wouldn't see the lights at night. My concern wasn't for security at night while I was home.Cliff notes:*Second camera worked*Second camera was moving without me controlling it*Possibility of camera being hacked and controlled by 2nd party

review_body: So this device looks exactly as in product pictures. This camera is not that big and fits in most places. The mobility of it is 360 degrees even though you do eventually hit a turning max in both directions; looks directly up but when it comes to looking down it is limited but manageable. The setup literally took me 2 minutes, so wicked easy. The app is OK, not the best but very easy to use and configure settings. Able to share the camera feed between multiple accounts and devices. The only con about this device I would have to say would be, in order to record on a extended period of time you have to stay in the app BUT it does record videos of when it detects motion and saves it via a micro SD or cloud storage. So I would recommended purchasing a micro SD so you don't have to pay monthly for cloud storage. Also with the motion detection it does alert your phone via notification from the app. You can also take photos, videos and even allows you to talk through the camera from the app. So as for a inside the house camera (definitely not made for outdoors) it is the best I have found. I was able to get a deal on this camera but I would pay up to $80 for this camera because it is that good, definitely worth the buy.

review_title: Decent vid quality. Unreliable iPhone app. Motion detect is erratic. Ended up hating it!
review_body: All I want is a WiFi camera with motion detection to sit inside front window to watch the porch. FAIL. Regardless of the "sensibility" setting 0-5, it detects and alerts the tiniest movement (from cars on the distant road with lights on or reflections, or reflections off of the window). Yet, drive an SUV 15' away right in front of the camera in plain view - and nothing. Someone can walk up the driveway, be entirely in view of the camera from the driveway, walk onto the porch, place a package . . . and it MIGHT trigger when they're about 3' away, saving a nice short video of their waist, and them walking away. So unreliable it's useless. Besides, scrolling back through video (I record always) is grueling in the app, making that nearly useless also.Connectivity trying to review triggered events is hit-and-miss. The camera and iPhone are 10' away from WiFi router, yet often this stupid camera finds, then fails to playback the video snippet - so after a short time, just reverts to showing the current view (without notice). Try again and it might playback.Bottom line is it's unreliable enough to be aggravating - saving and alerting useless events, and missing blatant needed events. What WERE they thinking designing this thing?There is NO motion zones to set - it's all or nothing. My very old D-link camera allowed setting motion detect zones as a grid across the camera's field of view - and NEVER falsed nor missed. Too bad it's too old now to be viable. So I'm on the hunt for something like that. Doesn't seem like too much to ask.

review_body: Many wireless security cameras are similar in that they perform comparable functions but the video apps can make a real difference and this one is easy to set up with simplicity in mind. You can't have multiple cameras on one account but most people aren't getting this expecting to fulfill a task like an outdoor property setup. The camera is compact and has a screw mount on the bottom for tripod options but is equally comfortable on a tabletop. Unlike many cameras at this price point, this one possesses two-way audio communication which is very convenient. Low-lux nighttime capability is necessary for baby monitoring and this fits that requirement if needed. I can only vouch for the iOS version but it has all the necessary prerequisites suited for my needs. The manual is pretty good, in multiple languages of course, but the lettering font is small...hope you have good eyesight. Motion detection and hi-rez picture are what you get here. Also a one-year warranty helps build confidence as I have had this for a month with no issues; typically if these work for the initial burn-in period, then they rarely give me problems. Accepts up to a 64GB SD and cloud memory is accessible so that requirement is fulfilled. Hardwire ethernet-capable where WiFi is sketchy in your house and good for 2.4GB which is nearly every router out there; not 5GB. All-in-all, an inexpensive unit with many useful features that covers all the bases.

review_body: I bought this camera due to a recent break-in. Not knowing much about surveillance cameras , I bought this one mainly due to the price and saw that it had good reviews. The camera, however, is difficult to set up. Difficult but not impossible, patience is a must here. The manual that comes with the camera is sketchy at best. There's a QR tag on the first page to install the app on your phone but it might not work if your phone doesn't allow downloads from unknown sources. I downloaded the app from Google Play and it worked fine. Watch every tutorial you can and read every review. Make sure you buy a micro disk for this camera, regular disks will be too large. Also, make sure that when you install the disk that you put it in upside down (with prongs facing up) or you won't be able to get it into the camera. You will have to push the disk into the slot with your fingernail until it disappears. Be sure to have the camera unplugged when you install the disk or it won't be detected by the camera. Once you work out the bugs though, it's pretty good and has a decent picture. The video loops every 24 hours starting at 12 midnight. Playback does seem to skip at points and camera will go offline if you're in a location with a poor connection. But I sure wish I had this camera when I got robbed.

review_body: This is a special gift for my wife who always is always worried about what her little puppy does when he is left alone at home. My wife is happy after I taught her how to use this smart and helpful wireless camera. First, you have to pick up a perfect location to put the camera. For us, to put it in the small table next to the entrance door is great. Then, the set up is easy. As long as you follow the instruction, you should be able to finish the setup in 5 minutes. After all is done, you can use the APP to control the direction where the camera should look at. Or just ask the camera to do a 360 angle picture taking. The picture and video quality is good enough for a small camera like this. What is great is the camera can detect movements at night and alarm your cell phone so you know you dog wakes up and walking around. My wife is glad that I bought this. We recommend it.

review_body: Overall this is a good device for instant monitoring but it lacks a very important feature which makes it useless for long term monitoring. The video camera has to be on when you are using it. If you prefer to receive just the sounds and occasionally check the video there is no such feature.The reason for this feature to be so important is that keeping the video on drains the battery of your phone and you can't keep it on for a long period of time. If you have a baby sleeping in his/her room and you want to find out if she wakes up and cries you have to keep the video and sound on for hours and it will drain your battery very quickly and also the phone starts heating up.Listen only mode is a simple feature to add and it will minimize the power consumption of the phone as the transmission of sound requires very little use of data bandwidth and therefore battery. In listen only mode you can keep the connection on for a long time and monitor the baby. I hope they will add this feature soon as a software upgrade.

review_title: WARNING: If you have any special characters in your wifi password this camera will not work
review_body: Setup fails repeatedly; keeps saying my wifi password is wrong.  After reading the fine print in the manual it appears the problem is that the software simply can't recognize special characters (!,#,@,=,*,$,&,etc) in a wifi password.  So now I have to reset my network wifi password so as to make it less secure just for this if I want it to work, which will also require me going into every other device on my wifi network and changing all their logins with the new password.  The camera hardware might be fine but the app is complete junk to the point where the camera is functionally useless.

review_body: I read someone's comments on Twitter about what a great little camera this is for the price so I ordered one. I want to keep an eye on my cat and the house while I'm away. Motion detection function is available but only with SD Card inserted. It will also record and save videos to SD card or have video recorded to App album with no SD card. I use it with Wi-Fi only but it will work with mobile data. I like the 2 way audio feature but it freaks out my cat so I don't plan to use much for now. I think my favorite feature is that you can pan the screen vertically and horizontally or 360 ° and zoom in. It even has 3 shooting angles depending on whether the camera will be used table top, wall or ceiling mount. I was really impressed with all the features included for the low price. It's cute and small and picture quality isn't great at night but still good enough. The only thing I don't like is that the power cord needs to be plugged in to outlet or USB, no battery, but not a deal breaker for me. I still love this little camera.
